text: - I'm Sangeetha.
I'm an Engineering Manager
for Systems Manager Automation Team.
The team that I'm on in Cloud Management
helps customers automate remediation tasks
and other operational tasks in AWS.
It's been amazing working on this team.

We are enabling some very
compelling customer scenarios

for users of AWS and how to
manage their infrastructure.
My biggest surprise when I joined AWS

is how the leadership principles
are so much a part of AWS.

It really teaches you how
to be an effective leader
and how to be really,
a representational leader for your team
and focus on their growth.

It's important to understand
what people's career goals are,
what our customers want,
and build an experience for the team
and the customer that aligns both
so that we both win together.
The team is working on
a lot of interesting customer use cases.
They are meaningful problems
that you can solve for the customer.
It's an incredibly technical space.
That makes it very exciting.
Working in AWS Cloud Management,
we offer a very flexible work style.

We offer a really clear
growth path for your career
to get to the next level.
And the rest of it,
you are part of AWS

and that makes it exciting
from a technical standpoint
and from a career growth standpoint.
